argument.description: Value to return if boolean_expression evaluates to true.
Value to return if boolean_expression evaluates to false.

returnType: Returns the data type with the highest precedence from the types in true_value and false_value. For more information, see Data Type Precedence (Transact-SQL).
description: Returns one of two values, depending on whether the Boolean expression evaluates to true or false in SQL Server.
sample:
DECLARE @a int = 45, @b int = 40;  
SELECT IIF ( @a > @b, 'TRUE', 'FALSE' ) AS Result;
